intro: Geranium heterogamum, commonly known as the woodland geranium, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It typically grows to a height of 12 to 24 inches and features clusters of pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are often hairy and covered in fine绒毛. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
